clinical_study.brief_title: Therapeutic Effect of Chang'an I Recipe on Irritable Bowel Syndrome With Diarrhea
clinical_study.official_title: Therapeutic Effect of Chang'an I Recipe on Irritable Bowel Syndrome With Diarrhea: A Multicenter Randomized Double-Blind Placebo-Controlled Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Xiyuan Hospital of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

clinical_study.source: Xiyuan Hospital of China Academy of Chinese Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy and safety of TCM decoction Chang'an I Recipe in the treatment of IBS-D. A multicenter, randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial was designed. Patients were applied for central random number and were given corresponding treatment according to inclusion sequences.The treatment group was administered the Chang'an I Recipe, 150ml/bag, 3 times/day; while the control group was administered the placebo, 150ml/bag, 3 times/day. Both courses of treatment were 8 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: change of Irritable Bowel Syndrome Symptom Severity Score (IBS-SSS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: IBS-SSS was evaluated by patients at 0, 2, 4 ,6 and 8 weeks.
primary_outcome.description: Score less than 75 points was considered as in remission, 75~175 as mild, 175~300 as moderate, and over 300 as severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum markers regarding liver and kidney function

arm_group.description: Patients in this group were administered the Chang'an I Recipe for 8 weeks.
Patients in this group were administered the placebo for 8 weeks.

intervention.description: Patients in this group were administered the Chang'an I Recipe, 150ml/bag, 3 times/day for 8 weeks.
Patients in this group were administered the placebo, 150ml/bag, times/day for 8 weeks.
